description: A healthy Virginia creeper (Parthenocissus quinquefolia), a non-toxic vine with five-lobed leaves, is shown climbing a speed limit pole. The plant's bright green foliage contrasts with the dull gray of the metal surface.

A healthy Virginia creeper (Parthenocissus quinquefolia), a non-toxic vine with five-lobed leaves, is shown climbing a speed limit pole shown from a side angle. The plant's bright green foliage contrasts with the dull gray of the metal surface.

A Virginia creeper vine (Parthenocissus quinquefolia), a non-toxic vine known for its five-lobed leaves and reddish stems, clings tightly to the rough bark of a tree trunk. The plant is non-toxic and commonly found in forested areas.
